intro: Paronychia angorensis, commonly known as the Angolan sandthorn, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are often consumed by local wildlife. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its ecological importance lies in its role as a food source and habitat for various desert species.
